verbose_text: In athymic nude mice bearing MDA-MB-435 breast cancer xenografts, 64 Cu (L4) showed almost identical normal organ uptake to that in the glioma bearing animals, but its breast tumor uptake (1.26 +/- 0.10% ID/g) was significantly lower (p < 0.001) than that in the glioma (6.25 +/- 3.42% ID/g) because of MDR Pgps (P-glycoproteins) and MRPs (multidrug resistance associated proteins) overexpressed in the xenografted MDA-MB-435 breast tumors.
evidence: P-glycoproteins) and MRPs (multidrug resistance-associated proteins) overexpressed
